CatDescriptText: Mrs. Elizabeth Smithson, 3241 Arlington Avenue, Arlington Heights, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 9, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that licensed taverns are as harmful to a neighborhood as speakeasies and gambling joints? Why?" answer reads: "Speaking as a widowed Christian mother, I believe that licensed taverns, speakeasies, and gambling joints are menaces to the community, because my husband used to stop at the taverns and caused the family to be in want."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elizabeth Smithson, wearing plaid double breasted jacket, and dark bow at neck with button reading "Christ died for me", standing in front of chain link fence, possibly in front of Bedford Dwellings
